intro: Godetia lepida var. parviflora, commonly known as the slender godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This variety is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
